subject: p19640059
History: Pulmonary fibrosis and increased shortness of breath.
Findings: The heart size is top normal. The aorta is markedly tortuous. Reticular nodular opacities scattered at the lung bases are minimally changed since. There is increased opacity across the left upper lung zone, which may represent new edema or consolidation. There is no pneumothorax. The right costophrenic angle is obscured either by overlying fibrosis or small amount of fluid.
Impression: New left upper zone opacity which may represent asymmetric edema or new consolidation.
